result.execSummary:
The defendant Francisco Febo Lopez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Francisco  Febo Lopez in court with attorney Domingo S. Cruz.  Jennifer C. Tanck-Adams appeared for Noah Wishau for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Nancy Szeklinski.
  Interpreter:  Alberto Aguilar. Interpreter is sworn by the Court.
14CF584- Pl to Ct 1 as amended in the information to 2 cts Msd theft, Ct 2 in original information will be dismissed outright. In 14cf698, pl to Ct 1, Ct 2 is DRI. Based on pleas and restitution up front, the State recommends w/held sent - probation, 20 days RCJ and other approp conditions. Defense indicates deft has 2 days CFTS in each file.
P-G to all
COP filed, rights given
the deft waives rights to JT
the State relies on comp for FB - defense stipulates to same
finding of guilt

BTC: guilty as above. 14CF584-2 days RCJ-conc/CFTS, costs, DNA costs
                                    14CF698-2 days RCJ/CFTS, costs, DNA costs
PP for both files combined, $50/mo to begin 10-01-2014. FTP-10 consecutive days RCJ for each file for a total of 20.

Defendant Francisco  Febo Lopez in court with attorney Domingo S. Cruz.  Noah Wishau appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Kim Slaasted.
  Interpreter, Susan Schweigert, appeared on behalf of the defendant. Interpreter is sworn by the Court.
Defense indicates that deft needs to pay restitution in order to comply with the offer of the State. Defense has some money in their trust account. Defense is asking for signature bond in 14CF698 and cash to be put in Mr. Cruz's trust account. The State does not oppose the request.

BTC: modify bond in 14CF698 to signature bond.  Same amount and conditions. Cash is to be released to Atty Domingo Cruz to put in his trust account for restitution purposes.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 22, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with victim store except for restitution purposes.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
Plea hearing scheduled for July 21, 2014 at 10:00 am.
